questions.question_text:
Given:

//IMG//


To secure this code, you want to make sure that the client code cannot modify the public static fields.

Which code will accomplish this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
interface -> variable final static

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. By defining the fields in an interface, you can make sure that the client code cannot modify them. In an interface, all fields are implicitly public, static, and final, so their values cannot be changed once they are initialized.

C In Java, interface variables are implicitly considered as constants and are therefore effectively final. By default, all variables declared in an interface are implicitly marked as public, static, and final, regardless of whether the public, static, or final modifiers are explicitly specified.

Selected Answer: B
answer: B
provides <service-interface> with <service-implementation>
A module can specify that it provides a service with a specific type of service provider.

"requires PrintServiceAPI" bacause service provider is defined in the third separate module PrintServiceAPI.

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. A service provider module should use the provides directive to declare that it provides an implementation of a service. The provides directive specifies the service type and the implementation class. In this case, the PrintServiceProvider module provides an implementation of the org.printservice.spi.Print service with the com.provider.PrintService class.

E is correct

The method setValue(capture#1-of ?) in the type MyType<capture#1-of ?> is not applicable for the arguments (int)
